alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 7:15PM EDT until July 14 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Thompsonville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Lowland flooding will begin along the Connecticut River near Thompsonville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EDT Thursday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 14.7 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 04/15/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM EDT.
